isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 5000 9100 9200 9400 9900 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - 5000, 5000i, 9000, 9000i - DIAGNOSTICS - GAUGE CIRCUIT TROUBLESHOOTING

svcproc.title: GAUGE CIRCUIT TROUBLESHOOTING
svcproc.para: If during the power up Speedometer/Tachometer self test, one or more of the electronic gauges did not go through the full sweep and did not go to the 6 o'clock position:

step1.para: Switch the gauge with one of the other electronic gauges that went through the full sweep. Rerun the power up test.

step2.para: Oil Pressure, Water Temperature, Voltmeter or Fuel Gauge - If the suspect gauge went through the full sweep in a different gauge location, and the known good gauge in the suspect location did not make a full sweep, go to step C.

If the speedometer or tachometer are switched and the suspect gauge went through the full sweep in the other location, and the known good gauge in the suspect location did not make a full sweep, replace the Speedometer/Tachometer module.
If the suspect gauge did not go through a full sweep in a different location and the known good gauge moved to the suspect location, went through a full sweep, replace the suspect gauge.

Oil Pressure, Water Temperature, Voltmeter, Fuel - If the known good gauge did not go through a full sweep in the suspect gauge location, refer to TROUBLESHOOTINGand troubleshoot the gauge circuits between the Speedometer/Tachometer module and the suspect gauge cluster pins. If the gauge circuits to the cluster pins check good, replace the Speedometer/Tachometer module.
